Package com.kneelawk.graphlib.api.graph.user

Interface BlockNode

All Known Subinterfaces:
CenterWireBlockNode, FullWireBlockNode, SidedBlockNode, SidedFaceBlockNode, SidedWireBlockNode
public interface BlockNode
Interface that all block nodes should implement.

A block node is a piece of immutable data that sits in a block graph and can be used to allow utilities to determine which blocks are connected to which and how.

In Wired Redstone, each wire or gate has at least one block node associated with it. For example, each red-alloy wire part has a single associated red-alloy wire node. These nodes are then connected according to a set of rules and then traversed when ever a wire receives a redstone signal, allowing all connected wires to receive the same signal, causing them all to update at the same time with the same redstone value.

See Also:
  • WireConnectionDiscoverers

  • Method Details

    • getType

      @NotNull @NotNull BlockNodeType getType()
      Gets this block node's type ID, associated with its decoder.

      A block node's BlockNodeDecoder must always be registered with GraphUniverse.addNodeType(BlockNodeType) under the same ID as returned here.

      Returns:
      the id of this block node.

    • toTag

      @Nullable @Nullable net.minecraft.nbt.NbtElement toTag()
      Encodes this block node's data to an NBT element.

      This can return null if this block node's type is all the data that needs to be stored.

      Returns:
      a (possibly null) NBT element describing this block node's data.

    • toPacket

      default void toPacket(@NotNull @NotNull NetByteBuf buf, @NotNull @NotNull IMsgWriteCtx ctx)
      Encodes this block node's data into a packet for server to client synchronization.

      This does not need to write anything if this block node's type is all the data that needs to be sent.

      Parameters:
      buf - the buffer to write this node's data to.
      ctx - the message context, used for writing to caches.

    • isAutomaticRemoval

      default boolean isAutomaticRemoval(@NotNull @NotNull NodeHolder<BlockNode> self)
      Checks if this block node should be automatically removed.

      Automatic removal is performed if a BlockNodeDiscoverer stops discovering the given node at the given position.

      Parameters:
      self - this node's holder, holding the context of this node.
      Returns:
      true if this node should be automatically removed.

    • shouldHaveNodeEntity

      default boolean shouldHaveNodeEntity(@NotNull @NotNull NodeHolder<BlockNode> self)
      Checks whether this specific node should have a node entity associated with it.

      Note: if this returns true and GraphWorld.addBlockNode(NodePos, NodeEntity) is called with a null node entity, then createNodeEntity(NodeHolder) is called to create a new node entity.

      Parameters:
      self - this node's holder, holding the context of this node.
      Returns:
      true if this node should have a node entity associated with it.

    • createNodeEntity

      @Nullable default @Nullable NodeEntity createNodeEntity(@NotNull @NotNull NodeHolder<BlockNode> self)
      Creates a new node entity that will be associated with this node.
      Parameters:
      self - this node's holder, holding the context of this node.
      Returns:
      a newly created node entity, or null if an entity could not be created.

    • findConnections

      @NotNull @NotNull Collection<HalfLink> findConnections(@NotNull @NotNull NodeHolder<BlockNode> self)
      Collects nodes in the world that this node can connect to.

      Contract: This method must only return nodes that canConnect(NodeHolder, HalfLink) would have returned true for.

      Parameters:
      self - this node's holder, holding the context of this node.
      Returns:
      all nodes this node can connect to.
      See Also:
      • WireConnectionDiscoverers

    • canConnect

      boolean canConnect(@NotNull @NotNull NodeHolder<BlockNode> self, @NotNull @NotNull HalfLink other)
      Determines whether this node can connect to another node.

      Contract: This method must only return true for nodes that would be returned from findConnections(NodeHolder).

      Parameters:
      self - this node's holder, holding the context of this node.
      other - the other node to attempt to connect to.
      Returns:
      whether this node can connect to the other node.
      See Also:
      • WireConnectionDiscoverers

    • onConnectionsChanged

      void onConnectionsChanged(@NotNull @NotNull NodeHolder<BlockNode> self)
      Called when the block graph controller has determined that this specific node's connections have been changed.

      This usually performs visual updates on the block associated with this node, but this can be used for other things as well. This method is also called on nodes that have been removed from a graph, after the graph has finished removing them.

      Note: This is not called for every node change in a graph, only when this specific node's connection's have changed.

      Parameters:
      self - this node's holder, holding the context of this node.

    • isValid

      default boolean isValid(@NotNull @NotNull NodeHolder<BlockNode> self)
      Checks whether this node is valid at the given position.

      This method is used in cleaning up after a de-sync between the block world and the graph world. This method is called occasionally, and block nodes that should not be present, given the state of the block world, are removed.

      Parameters:
      self - the node holder holding this node's context.
      Returns:
      true if this node is valid and should remain that its current position.

    • hashCode

      int hashCode()
      Block nodes are compared based on their hash-code and equals functions.

      Block nodes must always implement consistent hash-code and equals functions, as this allows the block graph controller to be able to correctly evaluate if nodes need to be removed or added at a given position.

      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
      Returns:
      the hash-code of this block node's data.

    • equals

      boolean equals(@Nullable @Nullable Object o)
      Block nodes are compared based on their hash-code and equals functions.

      Block nodes must always implement consistent hash-code and equals functions, as this allows the block graph controller to be able to correctly evaluate if nodes need to be removed or added at a given position.

      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      o - the other node to compare this node to.
      Returns:
      true if these two nodes hold the same data, false otherwise.

    • toDebugPacket

      default void toDebugPacket(@NotNull @NotNull NodeHolder<BlockNode> self, @NotNull @NotNull net.minecraft.network.PacketByteBuf buf)
      Encodes this block node to a PacketByteBuf to be sent to the client for client-side graph debug rendering.

      The default implementations of this method are compatible with the default client-side block node decoders. This method does not need to be implemented in order for client-side graph debug rendering to work. This method should only be overridden to provide custom data to the client.

      If custom data is being sent to the client, use GraphLibClient.registerDebugDecoder(Identifier, Identifier, BlockNodeDebugPacketDecoder) to register a decoder for the custom data.

      Parameters:
      self - this node's holder, holding the context of this node.
      buf - the buffer to encode this node to.
